text: NF-AT activation induced by a <extra_id_0> CAML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - interacting member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily .
Activation of the nuclear factor of activated T cells transcription factor ( NF-AT ) is a key event underlying lymphocyte action .

The <extra_id_0> CAML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> calcium-modulator and cyclophilin ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) protein is a coinducer of NF-AT activation when overexpressed in Jurkat T cells .

text: A member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily was isolated by virtue of its affinity for <extra_id_0> CAML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Cross-linking of this lymphocyte - specific protein , designated <extra_id_0> TACI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> transmembrane activator and CAML-interactor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , on the surface of transfected Jurkat cells with <extra_id_0> TACI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific antibodies led to activation of the transcription factors NF-AT , AP-1 , and NFkappaB .

<extra_id_0> TACI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced activation of NF-AT was specifically blocked by a dominant - negative <extra_id_0> CAML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant , thus implicating <extra_id_0> CAML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as a signaling intermediate .
